reviews.review_msg: So nice! Very helpful and very encouraging during discussion. He uses a lot of pop culture and historical references to support what he teaches. Very approachable and accessible for extra help. One of my favourite profs.

Probably one of the nicest profs I've ever met. Really tries hard to get the material across to his students and responds positively to their thoughts and ideas: no matter what, he will find a way to connect what they say to what he teaches without putting them down. Makes presentations a whole lot easier!

Nicky is oddly inconsistent in what she expects from students. She will be extremely lenient with topics and grading schemes if you talk to her about it within her time frame.  Her late policies, though, are totally non-negotiable. Also some useless class material, but overall, interesting. You set your own level and she rewards you for meeting it.

Had her in 103, had a bad time, decided to give her another chance since it's a 300 level class. BIG MISTAKE. The Wiki assignment was a complete waste of time. All we do is "Student Centred Learning" meaning she's too lazy to teach.

Treats students like young children. Lectures are terrible and are only attended for participation. Grammar lessons useless. Wiki assignment even worse. Encourages quantity over quality for participation. Organized chaos. Do NOT take any of her classes. Worst prof I have had.

Ogden is a disgrace to students everywhere.  He discriminates against his students.  It is easy to get an A grade as long as u do what Ogden says,  Independent thought is not allowed in Ogden's class. Smart people beware.

Ogden was the worst teacher during my SFU english major.  He is a disgrace to students and teachers.  He demands you respect his authority when he has no idea how to teach.  Ogden is a conceded disgrace to teachers everywhere.  He is a sad man.

Do not take this course.  It is an easy A grade if you do what he says.  It is not worth it. Ogden is pure evil and only seeks to please his pride.  If you kiss his behind u will do well if not then prepare a D grade.

Amusing and provoking, Ogden really makes you think. Although the class was too unstructured for me, his feedback on written assignments was most helpful. Extremely approachable and easy to deal with in my experience.

GREAT PROF!!! I entered the course thinking I hated sci fi and fantasy and suprisingly enough, thanks to her reading selections I have a whole new genre open to me for the summer.  She has a relaxed way about her and is VERY considerate of her students.  Go to class, work hard and you'll be fine with Karyn!

Good instructor with interesting lectures. Only thing I would say is that project feedback was not very in-depth. Got a B on a project but all the feedback was positive, so no idea how to improve the next grade. He is easily approachable though so could totally ask him in person.

This course was an experimental one for him (the first he had ever taught which merged games with literature), so although it lacked the typical structure/organization youd want, this did not take away from the enjoyability of the course nor his amazing lecturing skills. Paul has a mix of knowledge, humor, and relatability that makes him worth it!

dont. students expressed concern at literally EVERYONE recieving a c- for a large portion of the grade, prof + ta only said "most of you were only 1% from a c it's really not a big deal" then wouldn't even round it up or curve it. focused on minor issues like pausing lecture at every noise like door opening but won't wear a mic. feedback is useless

extremely interesting lectures, made assignments relatively enjoyable, and fair marking. She doesn't mark easy but it's nice to be challenged. I would recommend this prof to anyone and would take a course with her again if the opportunity arose.
